sense.name: to make or be appropriate, convenient or right for a particular person, entity or occasion
sense.examples: The builders suited the house to the owner's qualifications. This aircraft design was suited to a particular mission. We could go now or this afternoon - whatever time suits you best. Corn is grown a lot in this area - the soil seems to suit it very well. The city lifestyle seems to suit me best. Choose casual clothes to suit the informal mood. That's a choice that suits us all. Such behavior doesn't suit a true leader. I'd still argue that PHP is better suited for web applications. That shade of red really suits your complexion. Lovely drawing, indeed! The colors suit quite well.

sense.name: put on a suit
sense.examples: Next, we suited up so we could get out in the race cars. Children suited up and headed for the beach. We suited up for a pleasure dive before breakfast.
